weapons.name: Club
weapons.description: A simple bludgeon, light enough to wield in the off hand.

weapons.name: Dagger
weapons.description: A versatile short blade usable with Strength or Dexterity, throwable at range.

weapons.name: Greatclub
weapons.description: A heavy two-handed wooden club dealing significant bludgeoning damage.

weapons.name: Handaxe
weapons.description: A light axe suitable for melee or throwing, usable in the off hand.

weapons.name: Javelin
weapons.description: A light throwing spear with good range.

weapons.name: Light hammer
weapons.description: A small hammer usable in melee or thrown, suitable for off-hand use.

weapons.name: Mace
weapons.description: A standard one-handed bludgeon favored by clerics.

weapons.name: Quarterstaff
weapons.description: A versatile wooden staff; deals 1d8 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Sickle
weapons.description: A curved blade for harvesting, light enough for off-hand use.

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.description: A throwable polearm; deals 1d8 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Light crossbow
weapons.description: A two-handed crossbow requiring an action to reload. Good range and damage.

weapons.name: Dart
weapons.description: A small thrown projectile usable with Strength or Dexterity.

weapons.name: Shortbow
weapons.description: A two-handed bow with moderate range, no loading required.

weapons.name: Sling
weapons.description: A simple ranged weapon using stones or sling bullets as ammunition.

weapons.name: Battleaxe
weapons.description: A sturdy axe; deals 1d10 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Flail
weapons.description: A spiked ball on a chain, effective against shields.

weapons.name: Glaive
weapons.description: A heavy polearm with 10-foot reach. Requires Strength 13 or attacks have Disadvantage.

weapons.name: Greataxe
weapons.description: A massive two-handed axe dealing the highest single-die damage.

weapons.name: Greatsword
weapons.description: A large two-handed sword with the highest average damage among martial weapons.

weapons.name: Halberd
weapons.description: An axe-bladed polearm with 10-foot reach.

weapons.name: Lance
weapons.description: A long weapon with 10-foot reach. Requires two hands unless you are mounted.

weapons.name: Longsword
weapons.description: A standard martial sword; deals 1d10 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Maul
weapons.description: A massive two-handed hammer with high average bludgeoning damage.

weapons.name: Morningstar
weapons.description: A spiked mace dealing piercing damage, no special properties.

weapons.name: Pike
weapons.description: A long, heavy spear with 10-foot reach.

weapons.name: Rapier
weapons.description: The best one-handed finesse weapon, usable with Strength or Dexterity.

weapons.name: Scimitar
weapons.description: A curved finesse blade, light enough for dual wielding.

weapons.name: Shortsword
weapons.description: A light finesse blade ideal for dual wielding with piercing damage.

weapons.name: Trident
weapons.description: A three-pronged spear that can be thrown; deals 1d10 two-handed.

weapons.name: War pick
weapons.description: A military pick for piercing armor; deals 1d10 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Warhammer
weapons.description: A martial hammer; deals 1d10 when wielded two-handed.

weapons.name: Whip
weapons.description: A finesse weapon with 10-foot reach but low damage.

weapons.name: Blowgun
weapons.description: A tube for shooting needles, often used with poison. Minimal damage.

weapons.name: Hand crossbow
weapons.description: A one-handed crossbow, light enough for dual wielding. Requires loading.

weapons.name: Heavy crossbow
weapons.description: A powerful two-handed crossbow with excellent range and high damage. Requires loading.

weapons.name: Longbow
weapons.description: A large two-handed bow with the longest range of any weapon. Requires Strength 13 or attacks have Disadvantage.

weapons.name: Musket
weapons.description: A long-barreled firearm with devastating stopping power at medium range. Requires loading after each shot.

weapons.name: Pistol
weapons.description: A one-handed firearm with solid damage at short range. Requires loading after each shot.

armor.name: Padded
armor.description: Quilted layers of cloth. Light armor with stealth disadvantage.

armor.name: Leather
armor.description: Breastplate and shoulder protectors made of stiffened leather. No stealth penalty.

armor.name: Studded leather
armor.description: Leather reinforced with rivets. The best light armor for AC.

armor.name: Hide
armor.description: Crude armor of thick furs and pelts. No stealth penalty.

armor.name: Chain shirt
armor.description: Interlocking metal rings worn under clothing. Good AC without stealth penalty.

armor.name: Scale mail
armor.description: Overlapping metal scales on leather. Stealth disadvantage.

armor.name: Breastplate
armor.description: A fitted metal chest piece. Same AC as scale mail without stealth penalty.

armor.name: Half plate
armor.description: Metal plates covering most of the body. Best medium armor AC. Stealth disadvantage.

armor.name: Ring mail
armor.description: Leather with heavy metal rings sewn in. Entry-level heavy armor.

armor.name: Chain mail
armor.description: Interlocking metal rings. Requires Str 13 or speed is reduced by 10 ft.

armor.name: Splint
armor.description: Vertical metal strips riveted to backing. Requires Str 15 or speed is reduced by 10 ft.

armor.name: Plate
armor.description: Full plate armor offering the highest AC. Requires Str 15 or speed is reduced by 10 ft.

armor.name: Shield
armor.description: Held in one hand. Grants +2 AC. Can be donned or doffed as an action.

gear.name: Acid
gear.description: As part of the Attack action, a creature can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet or hurl it up to 20 feet, shattering on impact. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d6 Acid damage.

gear.name: Alchemist's Fire
gear.description: As part of the Attack action, a creature can hurl this flask up to 20 feet, shattering on impact. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus) or take 1d4 Fire damage and have the Burning condition.

gear.name: Antitoxin
gear.description: As a Bonus Action, you can drink this or administer it to a creature within 5 feet. The drinker has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

gear.name: Backpack
gear.description: Holds up to 30 pounds of gear, not exceeding 1 cubic foot.

gear.name: Ball Bearings
gear.description: As a Utilize action, you can spill ball bearings from their pouch to cover a level, 10-foot-square area. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or have the Prone condition. Moving at half speed avoids the save.

gear.name: Barrel
gear.description: A cylindrical container that holds up to 40 gallons of liquid or 4 cubic feet of dry goods.

gear.name: Basket
gear.description: A wicker container that holds up to 40 pounds or 2 cubic feet of goods.

gear.name: Bedroll
gear.description: A portable sleeping pad.

gear.name: Bell
gear.description: A small metal bell.

gear.name: Blanket
gear.description: A heavy woolen blanket.

gear.name: Block and Tackle
gear.description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them. You can use it to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

gear.name: Book
gear.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else.

gear.name: Bottle, Glass
gear.description: A glass bottle that holds up to 1.5 pints of liquid.

gear.name: Bucket
gear.description: A cylindrical container that holds up to 3 gallons of liquid or half a cubic foot of dry goods.

gear.name: Caltrops
gear.description: As a Utilize action, you can spread caltrops to cover a 5-foot-square area. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 1 Piercing damage and have its Speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

gear.name: Candle
gear.description: Sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 5 feet for 1 hour.

gear.name: Case, Crossbow Bolt
gear.description: This wooden case holds up to 20 crossbow bolts.

gear.name: Case, Map or Scroll
gear.description: This cylindrical leather case holds up to 10 rolled-up sheets of paper or 5 rolled-up sheets of parchment.

gear.name: Chain (10 feet)
gear.description: Has 10 Hit Points. Can be burst with a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check.

gear.name: Chest
gear.description: Holds up to 12 cubic feet or 300 pounds of gear.

gear.name: Climber's kit
gear.description: Includes pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. Lets you anchor yourself when climbing.

gear.name: Clothes, Fine
gear.description: A set of fine clothes suitable for high society.

gear.name: Clothes, Traveler's
gear.description: Sturdy clothing suitable for long journeys.

gear.name: Costume
gear.description: A set of clothes and accessories for use in disguise or performance.

gear.name: Crowbar
gear.description: Grants Advantage on Strength checks where leverage can be applied.

gear.name: Flask
gear.description: A glass or metal container holding about 1 pint of liquid.

gear.name: Grappling hook
gear.description: An iron hook used with rope for climbing.

gear.name: Healer's kit
gear.description: 10 uses. As a Utilize action, you can expend one use to stabilize a creature that has 0 Hit Points without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

gear.name: Holy Water
gear.description: As part of the Attack action, a creature can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet or hurl it up to 20 feet, shattering on impact. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d8 Radiant damage. The target must be a Fiend or Undead.

gear.name: Hunting Trap
gear.description: As a Utilize action, you can set this trap, which is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object. A creature that steps on the trap must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 Piercing damage and have its Speed reduced to 0 until the creature breaks free. A creature can break free with a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check.

gear.name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
gear.description: A small bottle of black ink.

gear.name: Ink pen
gear.description: A pen for writing with ink.

gear.name: Jug
gear.description: A ceramic or metal jug that holds up to 1 gallon of liquid.

gear.name: Ladder
gear.description: A 10-foot wooden ladder.

gear.name: Lamp
gear.description: Casts Bright Light in a 15-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. Burns for 6 hours on a flask of oil.

gear.name: Lantern, bullseye
gear.description: Casts Bright Light in a 60-foot cone and Dim Light for an additional 60 feet. Burns for 6 hours on a flask of oil.

gear.name: Lantern, hooded
gear.description: Casts Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. Burns for 6 hours on a flask of oil.

gear.name: Lock
gear.description: A basic lock with a key. DC 15 Dexterity check with thieves' tools to pick.

gear.name: Magnifying Glass
gear.description: Grants Advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect a highly detailed item. Can also be used to start fires by focusing sunlight.

gear.name: Manacles
gear.description: Bind a creature. DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check or DC 15 Dexterity check with thieves' tools to escape.

gear.name: Map
gear.description: A map of a region, city, or dungeon. Useful for navigation and exploration.

gear.name: Mirror, steel
gear.description: A small steel mirror for personal use or looking around corners.

gear.name: Net
gear.description: As part of the Attack action, a creature can use a Net to try to restrain another creature within 15 feet. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus) or have the Restrained condition until freed. A creature can free the Restrained creature by using its action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check. Dealing 5 Slashing damage (AC 10) to the Net also ends the effect, destroying the Net.

gear.name: Oil (flask)
gear.description: You can douse a creature, object, or a 5-foot-square area with the oil. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 Fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there. You can also pour oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided the surface is level. Oil can be used as fuel for a Lamp or Lantern, burning for 6 hours.

gear.name: Paper (one sheet)
gear.description: A single sheet of paper.

gear.name: Parchment
gear.description: A sheet of parchment made from animal hide, suitable for writing.

gear.name: Perfume
gear.description: A vial of fine perfume.

gear.name: Poison, Basic
gear.description: As a Bonus Action, you can use this poison to coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. A creature that takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition takes an extra 1d4 Poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains its potency for 1 minute or until the weapon hits.

gear.name: Pole
gear.description: A 10-foot wooden pole useful for probing, vaulting, or triggering traps from a distance.

gear.name: Pot, Iron
gear.description: An iron cooking pot that holds up to 1 gallon of liquid.

gear.name: Potion of healing
gear.description: As a Bonus Action, you can drink this potion or administer it to a creature within 5 feet. The drinker regains 2d4 + 2 Hit Points.

gear.name: Pouch
gear.description: A cloth or leather belt pouch holding up to 6 pounds or 1/5 cubic foot.

gear.name: Quiver
gear.description: Holds up to 20 arrows.

gear.name: Ram, Portable
gear.description: Grants a +4 bonus to Strength checks made to break down doors. One other character can help, giving Advantage on the check.

gear.name: Rations (1 day)
gear.description: Dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

gear.name: Robe
gear.description: A loose-fitting garment often worn by spellcasters.

gear.name: Rope
gear.description: 50 feet of rope. Can be burst with a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check.

gear.name: Sack
gear.description: A cloth sack holding up to 30 pounds or 1 cubic foot.

gear.name: Shovel
gear.description: A standard digging shovel.

gear.name: Signal whistle
gear.description: A small whistle for signaling.

gear.name: Spell Scroll (Cantrip)
gear.description: A spell scroll bearing a cantrip. Any creature that can read the language of the scroll can use an action to read the scroll and cast the spell. The scroll is then consumed.

gear.name: Spell Scroll (Level 1)
gear.description: A spell scroll bearing a 1st-level spell. If the spell is on your spell list, you can use an action to read the scroll and cast the spell. If not, the scroll is unintelligible. The scroll is consumed after use.

gear.name: Spikes, Iron
gear.description: A set of 10 iron spikes. Can be used to wedge doors, anchor ropes, or as climbing aids.

gear.name: Spyglass
gear.description: Objects viewed through the spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

gear.name: String
gear.description: 10 feet of string. Useful for tying things together or setting tripwires.

gear.name: Tent, two-person
gear.description: A simple portable canvas shelter for two.

gear.name: Tinderbox
gear.description: Lighting a Candle, Lamp, Lantern, or Torch takes a Bonus Action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

gear.name: Torch
gear.description: Burns for 1 hour. Bright Light 20-foot radius, Dim Light additional 20 feet. On a hit as a Simple Melee weapon, deals 1 Fire damage.

gear.name: Vial
gear.description: A small glass container holding up to 4 ounces of liquid.

gear.name: Waterskin
gear.description: Holds up to 4 pints of liquid. Full weight listed; empty weighs 0 pounds.

gear.name: Arrows (20)
gear.description: Standard arrows for a shortbow or longbow.

gear.name: Crossbow bolts (20)
gear.description: Standard bolts for a crossbow.

gear.name: Sling bullets (20)
gear.description: Lead bullets for a sling.

gear.name: Blowgun needles (50)
gear.description: Thin needles for a blowgun.

gear.name: Firearm Bullets (10)
gear.description: Lead bullets for a musket or pistol.

gear.name: Alchemist's Supplies
gear.description: Artisan's tools for creating alchemical substances such as acid, alchemist's fire, antitoxin, oil, perfume, and soap.
gear.utilize: Identify a substance (DC 15), or start a fire (DC 15)

gear.name: Brewer's Supplies
gear.description: Artisan's tools for brewing ales, ciders, meads, and other beverages.
gear.utilize: Detect poisoned drink (DC 15), or identify alcohol (DC 10)

gear.name: Calligrapher's Supplies
gear.description: Artisan's tools for fine lettering, document creation, and forgery detection.
gear.utilize: Write text with impressive flourishes that guard against forgery (DC 15)

gear.name: Carpenter's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for constructing and repairing wooden structures and objects.
gear.utilize: Seal or pry open a door or container (DC 20)

gear.name: Cartographer's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for creating and interpreting maps. Includes quills, ink, parchment, compasses, calipers, and a ruler.
gear.utilize: Draft a map of a small area (DC 15)

gear.name: Cobbler's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for making and repairing shoes and boots.
gear.utilize: Modify footwear to give Advantage on the wearer's next Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (DC 10)

gear.name: Cook's Utensils
gear.description: Artisan's tools for preparing food, including pots, knives, forks, a cutting board, and a stirring spoon.
gear.utilize: Improve food's flavor (DC 10), or detect spoiled or poisoned food (DC 15)

gear.name: Glassblower's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for shaping molten glass into bottles, vials, magnifying glasses, and other glass items.
gear.utilize: Discern what a glass object held in the past 24 hours (DC 15)

gear.name: Jeweler's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for cutting gems, setting stones, and crafting jewelry and holy symbols.
gear.utilize: Discern a gem's value (DC 15)

gear.name: Leatherworker's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for working with leather to create armor, pouches, waterskins, and other leather goods.
gear.utilize: Add a design to a leather item (DC 10)

gear.name: Mason's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for cutting and shaping stone for construction and masonry work.
gear.utilize: Chisel a symbol or hole in stone (DC 10)

gear.name: Painter's Supplies
gear.description: Artisan's tools for painting portraits, landscapes, and decorative art.
gear.utilize: Paint a recognizable image of something you've seen (DC 10)

gear.name: Potter's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for shaping clay into pots, jugs, lamps, and other ceramic items.
gear.utilize: Discern what a ceramic object held in the past 24 hours (DC 15)

gear.name: Smith's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for working metal to create weapons, armor, chains, and other metal goods.
gear.utilize: Pry open a door or container (DC 20)
craft: Any Melee weapon (except Club, Greatclub, Quarterstaff, and Whip)

gear.name: Tinker's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for repairing everyday objects and creating small mechanical devices, locks, and traps.
gear.utilize: Assemble a Tiny item composed of scrap, which falls apart in 1 minute (DC 20)

gear.name: Weaver's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for weaving cloth, rope, nets, and other textile goods.
gear.utilize: Mend a tear in clothing (DC 10), or sew a Tiny design (DC 10)

gear.name: Woodcarver's Tools
gear.description: Artisan's tools for carving wood into weapons, arcane focuses, arrows, and other wooden items.
gear.utilize: Carve a pattern in wood (DC 10)
craft: Ranged weapons (except Pistol, Musket, and Sling)

gear.name: Disguise Kit
gear.description: A pouch of cosmetics, hair dye, small props, and a few pieces of clothing. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to create a visual disguise.
gear.utilize: Apply makeup (DC 10)

gear.name: Forgery Kit
gear.description: A kit for forging documents. Includes papers, inks, quills, seals, and wax. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to create a forged document.
gear.utilize: Mimic 10 or fewer words of someone else's handwriting (DC 15), or duplicate a wax seal (DC 20)

gear.name: Gaming Set
gear.description: A gaming set covers a wide range of game pieces, including dice and decks of cards. Proficiency with a gaming set lets you add your proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set. Variants: Dice Set (1 sp), Dragonchess Set (1 gp), Playing Card Set (5 sp), Three-Dragon Ante Set (1 gp).
gear.utilize: Discern whether someone is cheating (DC 10), or win the game (DC 20)

gear.name: Gaming Set (Dice)
gear.description: A set of dice for gambling games.

gear.name: Gaming Set (Dragonchess)
gear.description: A dragonchess set, a complex strategy game popular across the realms.

gear.name: Gaming Set (Playing Cards)
gear.description: A deck of playing cards for various card games.

gear.name: Gaming Set (Three-Dragon Ante)
gear.description: A deck of illustrated cards for the game of Three-Dragon Ante.

gear.name: Herbalism Kit
gear.description: Contains clippers, mortar and pestle, pouches, and vials for creating herbal remedies. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to identify or apply herbs.
gear.utilize: Identify a plant (DC 10)

gear.name: Navigator's Tools
gear.description: Used for navigation at sea. Includes a sextant, compass, calipers, ruler, parchment, ink, and a quill.
gear.utilize: Plot a course (DC 10), or determine position by stargazing (DC 15)

gear.name: Poisoner's Kit
gear.description: Includes glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to craft or use poisons.
gear.utilize: Detect a poisoned object (DC 10)

gear.name: Thieves' Tools
gear.description: Includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to Dexterity checks made to disable traps or open locks.
gear.utilize: Pick a lock (DC 15), or disarm a trap (DC 15)

gear.name: Bagpipes
gear.description: A musical instrument consisting of a bag and pipes. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Drum
gear.description: A percussion instrument. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Dulcimer
gear.description: A stringed instrument played by striking the strings with small hammers. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Flute
gear.description: A woodwind instrument. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Horn
gear.description: A brass instrument. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Lute
gear.description: A stringed instrument popular with bards. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Lyre
gear.description: A stringed instrument played by plucking. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Pan Flute
gear.description: A set of tubes of varying lengths bound together. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Shawm
gear.description: A double-reed woodwind instrument. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Viol
gear.description: A bowed stringed instrument. Proficiency lets you add your proficiency bonus to performance checks with this instrument.
gear.utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

gear.name: Component Pouch
gear.description: A small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the Material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost.

gear.name: Arcane Focus (Crystal)
gear.description: A crystal used as a spellcasting focus for arcane spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Arcane Focus (Orb)
gear.description: An orb used as a spellcasting focus for arcane spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Arcane Focus (Rod)
gear.description: A rod used as a spellcasting focus for arcane spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Arcane Focus (Staff)
gear.description: A staff used as a spellcasting focus for arcane spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Arcane Focus (Wand)
gear.description: A wand used as a spellcasting focus for arcane spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Druidic Focus (Sprig of Mistletoe)
gear.description: A sprig of mistletoe used as a druidic focus for druid spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Druidic Focus (Totem) (Legacy)
gear.description: A totem carved with spiritual symbols, used as a druidic focus for druid spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Druidic Focus (Wooden Staff)
gear.description: A wooden staff used as a druidic focus for druid spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Druidic Focus (Yew Wand)
gear.description: A yew wand used as a druidic focus for druid spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Holy Symbol (Amulet)
gear.description: A holy amulet bearing the symbol of a deity, used as a spellcasting focus for divine spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Holy Symbol (Emblem)
gear.description: A holy emblem engraved or painted on a shield or worn as a brooch, used as a spellcasting focus for divine spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Holy Symbol (Reliquary)
gear.description: A tiny box containing a sacred relic, used as a spellcasting focus for divine spells. Can be used in place of any Material component that doesn't have a specific cost.

gear.name: Lock Picks
gear.description: A set of slender metal tools used to open locks without a key. Typically included in Thieves' Tools.

gear.name: Manacles Key
gear.description: A small metal key designed to unlock a specific set of Manacles.

gear.name: Burglar's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, Ball Bearings, a Bell, 10 Candles, a Crowbar, a Hooded Lantern, 7 flasks of Oil, 5 Rations, Rope, a Tinderbox, and a Waterskin.

gear.name: Diplomat's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Chest, Fine Clothes, an Ink bottle, 5 Ink Pens, a Lamp, 2 Cases (Map or Scroll), 4 flasks of Oil, 5 sheets of Paper, 5 sheets of Parchment, a vial of Perfume, and a Tinderbox.

gear.name: Dungeoneer's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, Caltrops, a Crowbar, 2 flasks of Oil, 10 Rations, Rope, a Tinderbox, 10 Torches, and a Waterskin.

gear.name: Entertainer's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, a Bedroll, a Bell, a Bullseye Lantern, 3 Costumes, a Mirror, 8 flasks of Oil, 9 Rations, a Tinderbox, and a Waterskin.

gear.name: Explorer's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, a Bedroll, 2 flasks of Oil, 10 Rations, Rope, a Tinderbox, 10 Torches, and a Waterskin.

gear.name: Priest's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, a Blanket, Holy Water, a Lamp, 7 Rations, a Robe, and a Tinderbox.

gear.name: Scholar's Pack
gear.description: Includes a Backpack, a Book, Ink, an Ink Pen, a Lamp, 10 flasks of Oil, 10 sheets of Parchment, and a Tinderbox.

gear.name: Camel
gear.description: A hardy desert mount with good speed and solid carrying capacity.

gear.name: Draft Horse
gear.description: A strong horse bred for pulling heavy loads rather than riding.

gear.name: Elephant
gear.description: A massive beast with enormous carrying capacity. Requires an Exotic Saddle.

gear.name: Mastiff
gear.description: A large, fierce dog suitable as a mount for Small creatures or as a guard animal.

gear.name: Mule
gear.description: A reliable pack animal well suited to rugged terrain.

gear.name: Pony
gear.description: A small horse suitable as a mount for Small creatures.

gear.name: Riding Horse
gear.description: A fast horse bred for riding, the most common mount for overland travel.

gear.name: Warhorse
gear.description: A horse trained for combat with high speed and carrying capacity.

gear.name: Barding
gear.description: Armor designed for a mount. Costs four times the normal armor cost and weighs twice as much. A mount's Speed is reduced by 10 ft. while wearing barding.

gear.name: Carriage
gear.description: An enclosed wheeled vehicle pulled by draft animals.

gear.name: Cart
gear.description: A simple two-wheeled vehicle pulled by a draft animal.

gear.name: Chariot
gear.description: A light two-wheeled vehicle designed for speed, pulled by horses.

gear.name: Feed (per day)
gear.description: Feed for one mount or draft animal for one day.

gear.name: Saddle (Exotic)
gear.description: Required for riding an aquatic or a flying mount.

gear.name: Saddle (Military)
gear.description: Gives Advantage on any ability check you make to remain mounted. Comes with bit, bridle, and reins.

gear.name: Saddle (Riding)
gear.description: A standard saddle that comes with a bit, a bridle, and reins.

gear.name: Saddlebags
gear.description: Bags that attach to a saddle for carrying gear on a mount.

gear.name: Sled
gear.description: A vehicle designed to travel over snow and ice, pulled by draft animals.

gear.name: Stabling (per day)
gear.description: Stabling service for one mount for one day, including shelter and feed.

gear.name: Wagon
gear.description: A four-wheeled vehicle pulled by one or more draft animals.

gear.name: Galley
gear.description: A large, multi-oared warship designed for ramming and boarding actions.

gear.name: Keelboat
gear.description: A small, flat-bottomed boat used on lakes and rivers. Can be crewed by one person.

gear.name: Longship
gear.description: A long, narrow vessel built for speed and versatility, propelled by oars and sail.

gear.name: Rowboat
gear.description: A small boat propelled by oars, used on lakes and rivers. Weighs 100 pounds and can be carried.

gear.name: Sailing Ship
gear.description: A standard oceangoing merchant vessel propelled by sails.

gear.name: Warship
gear.description: A heavily armed and armored sailing vessel built for naval combat.
